intro: Icacorea ibaguensis, commonly known as the Ibaguense ipecac, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. Icacorea ibaguensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
